text: Now you see him, now you don’t… and now you’re seeing double.
Djinn come in many forms none more feared and revered across Araby then the Serpent.
This Djinn has given in to the burning power of Aqshy, though those that burn so bright do not burn long.

Ibn Naggazar was a brilliant, if somewhat maniacal Arabyan sorcerer.Whilst it is unknown whether his madness sprang from isolation, too many attempts at creating intoxicating elixirs or the honeyed promises of whispering daemons. There can be no doubt he was utterly insane.

Inside this ornate staff decorated with snake motifs is bound a malignant and ancient Serpent Djinn, imprisoned by powerful enchantments woven by Jaffar. Only Jaffar's will is strong enough to temporarily unleash it upon his enemies on the battlefield.
Jaffar's natural gravitas coupled with his sorcerous might produce an oppressive aura of dread and authority around him that none under his command can resist.
The sorcerer  utters a blessing onto the weapons of his allies, imbuing their attacks with the magic of the elements.
As if possessed by a Fire Efreet, the caster conjures scorching flames from his hands to burn his enemies to a crisp.
As if possessed by a Fire Efreet, the caster conjures scorching flames from his hands to burn his enemies to a crisp.
Channeling the immense powers of the Djinn through his own body, the sorcerer lays a terrible curse upon his foes.
Channeling the immense powers of the Djinn through his own body, the sorcerer lays a terrible curse upon his foes.
Conjured by an Arabyan sorcerer, a magical illusion exploits his enemy's most inner desires, distracting them from their foe.
Conjured by an Arabyan sorcerer, a magical illusion exploits his enemy's most inner desires, distracting them from their foe.
The wizard turns the ground into bottomless quicksand, dragging any unfortunates down into the abyss.
The wizard turns the ground into bottomless quicksand, dragging any unfortunates down into the abyss.
Commanding the desert spirit of Da'ru'de, the sorcerer engulfs his foes in a swirling cloud of choking sand and dust.
Commanding the desert spirit of Da'ru'de, the sorcerer engulfs his foes in a swirling cloud of choking sand and dust.
Bright beams of burning energy leap from the wizard's eyes and scythe through all before him.
Bright beams of burning energy leap from the wizard's eyes and scythe through all before him.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Give a Djinn too much freedom and they will start thinking dangerous thoughts.
Heat of the desert, the sand is on my face, without accomplice the soldier knows no disgrace...
Breathe in, release, breathe out, repeat.
Magical Support: Piercing Bolts of Ruin

One of the Golden Magus' most infamous creations, this fiery curved sword is kept most of the time inside a jar filled with a slimy orange solution. When drawn out of it, the sword catches a mystical fire that the Magus' uses for battle, theatrics and summoning Djinn spirits. Contrary to popular belief, the ship is named after the sword.
Orders the Flaming Scimitar's Fire Efreets to unleash a barrage of burning bolts upon your enemies.
Orders the Flaming Scimitar's Tempest Djinns to conjure a potent torrent of curved windswords upon the battlefield.
The cool and protective wind of the north, it blows away the evil and wrongness in the skies and shields all from harm.
The dusty and unforgivable wind of the south, it brings with it the fury and the sweltering heat of the desert.
The power the Golden Magus wields comes at a price. If his concentration wanes during battle, the Djinn under his control will sense his weakness and attempt to turn the Magus' power against himself.
Searing flames burst from the caster, burning everything around them.
A column of churning fire erupts from the battlefield, causing much destruction!
Devoted to their gods these Arabyans give out a shrill howl in their honour.
A mixture of chemicals that becomes a fiery liquid that is difficult to put out, conveniently packaged in a small clay pot.
Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.
Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.
Slay, slay and slay some more so I might feed on their souls, I demand it!
Your soul is mine, your very life is mine to devour! Hurry now, so you are merely the entree to my feast!
Death is not the end, give yourself to death, give yourself to martyrdom and your name will echo through the ages.
The deserts of Araby are a harsh mistress but not always...
It's as if they have melted away into the Arabyan dunes, nowhere to be seen.
The shard tears open a fragile portal to the realm of Chaos just long enough for vile Chaos Spawn to spill forth.
Trust absolutey in the gods, never let your faith waver and you may yet live.
Filled with dread, their bodies freeze for none can withstand the Gorgon's glare.
The tactical burning of special tobacco obscures the unit and its allies, making them harder to hit with missiles. It also temporarily numbs the pain of warriors in range.
Taken by Fatandira from the tomb of the Liche Lord Karitamen in the Borderlands, this pair of Nehekharan Khopeshes magically enhance their owner's combat skills, and weaken anyone struck by them.
As a Djinn's phyiscal manifestation is damaged, the enchantments keeping it bound to this plane further dissipate.
When a Djinn can't sustain its physical form anymore, it returns to whence it came, be it the vessel they are bound to, or back to their planer.
Djinn||This unit is a Djinn, an elemental spirit (has physical resistance, does not rout, is immune to terror, takes damage when [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]{{tr:morale}} is low)
The power and number of Djinn trapped in the vessels in the Carriage makes it a powerful nexus for aethyrical forces.
Fueled by a fanatic devotion to the Djinn, the Dervishes spin wildly during their charge.
As combat rages on, the Dervishes' zealotry drives them further into their trance, spinning recklessly, madly attacking the enemy even as they are being attacked themselves.

The nomad tribes of Araby have inhabited it for generations, well before the first cities were founded on the coasts. Their preffred fighting style consists on keeping distance with their foes using their mounts or knowledge of the terrain, while peppering them with projectiles, or if necessary, unleashing a furious charge on them.
The Black Scimitar Guards are one of the most elite units in the armies of Araby, as long as the fight goes in their favour, their pride will swell and embolden them to fight more effectively.
The Wizard ensorcels allied weapons, making them burn with a savage fire. The targets of the spell are augmented with superior flaming blades.
A cackling, flaming visage appears before the Wizard. With a gleeful screech, it swirls around the battlefield, immolating anything in its way.
